channel.title: My School Computers
channel.description: Well i never really thought of it until today. But why the hell does everyone have so strict of usage on computers except my school. I mean to get on any site i want to simply run cmd ping whatever.com enter ip into address bar. So why the fuck are schools so strict if some of them are so retarded?

item.title: My School Computers
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

Lol, the main reason our security got upgraded was because of the “hacking” that occured (not the fact that the hackers mostly consisted of script kiddies. LOL

Read full topic

item.title: My School Computers
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

Our school was pretty unrestricted. Everyone knew the common way to get around the school filters using firefox… Until a couple of people hacked the Administrator password of the computers in the school and shut down a whole room of computers (I wasn’t included, honest ;)). Now they have started blocking stuff and running monitoring software on us. We can no longer use Task Manager (nothing that Process Explorer won’t fix), and it probably won’t take them long to restrict more stuff.

I think that the strictness of most schools probably depends on the intelligence of the computer staff. For instance, we recently got a new IT person and they implemented all the blocks and shit…

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“N00b1, post:31, topic:210483”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=277349.msg2287260#msg2287260 date=1213975611]
So after it’s 100% safe and hundreds of nerds had tried, oh mighty N00B1 comes along and wipes the servers.
What a believable story.
[/quote]

nice to know you think of me that way =]

By 100% restrictions do you mean that your school have blocked all pages except from them you are allowed to use?

i mean if it had any kind of flash on it it was blocked if it had the slightest hint of any thing not to do with work it was blocked pretty much everything bar the schools website was blocked xD

and if you really want to know how i did it being the “oh mighty N00B1” (which i kinda like), then ill tell you.
i just installed the admin pack on one of the pces job done…[/quote]
Such a rebel, you are.
Bet you got major points from the Jocks wiping the school servers. (Y)

item.title: My School Computers
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

I finally got access to the school computers yesterday(almost everything is blocked… Their firefox doesnt even work). 5 minutes later i found a way to hack them. Open notepad> click save as> click up folder> until you get to my computer> then it shows you all the computers on the network and gives you full access to their hard disks.

Read full topic

100 of nerds act have tryed hacking into it and fucking up the system but have failed
then i come along after my mates force me to (nagged me for 2 weeks) skipped 3 lessons by the end of that time everyone was a administrator and i wiped the server’s clean
(Servers because my school was 2 schools next to each other now they have joined and put a satilite on the top of each roof to connect them up)

Glad they never found out who it was they said that person would never see the light of day again… they always thault someone went into the server room and fucked with the servers them self Bla nubs :D[/quote]

But there’s this boy justin who managed to get an old teachers account, went into the software and if you ask him he unrestricts your account. Only problem is that some gay teachers like to re apply restrictions.[/quote]
You just apply restrictions on the teacher so they don’t can add it again.

item.title: My School Computers
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

My school has the tightest security anywhere, but our IT is an idiot. The password to all the admin accounts are our school principal.

I had some fun near the end of school; I got Cain and Abel, which is a nice little program… Installed it on an admin account, and rerouted all the computers in the school through that one computer. Then, I turned on my firewall All the computers had no access to anything online, or on the school network.

I lol’d.

Read full topic

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:211673”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=277349.msg2270061#msg2270061 date=1213203448]
My school has about 7 technicians in everyday. We can’t run cmd or even make one. no way round
[/quote]
Steal a school computer, hax0r it, find out all the passwords and then plug a laptop into the network. At my school every username and password is stored on each computer and downloaded on startup. We just can’t access them because of rights and stuff.[/quote]
I can easily crack the passwords on my school.
I know all username and know that all password has 5 letters/number in it and i can reach the server from my own Laptop, just need a program.

But I don’t think that is a good idea, I don’t earn anything on it and not good if anyone see it.

Well i never really thought of it until today. But why the hell does everyone have so strict of usage on computers except my school. I mean to get on any site i want to simply run cmd ping whatever.com enter ip into address bar. So why the fuck are schools so strict if some of them are so retarded?

item.title: My School Computers
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

my school are quiet strict,
but they got it cause they bought expensive software, not because they are particularly intelligent,

i installed kubuntu linux on a machine there, and it has no sites blocked, and you can install anything you want on it, and you can go on msn and irc (no ports are blocked) and practically do anything the other windows machines can do.

one thing it doesnt have is where you login on your school account, there is just one user account and iv written its username and password on the monitor so everyone can use it, its quite popular
i guess it has two accounts if you count superuser

Read full topic

item.title: My School Computers
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

At our school we keep getting more restrictions. They can watch on every computer and when you are on a game site and they see it they add it to a blacklist or whatever. But there are quite a load of game sites so it doesn’t have much effect.

Read full topic
